result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek J Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid in 60 days or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek J Thomas

records.addlTxt: End of representation letter filed by Atty. Kees.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:49 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derek J Thomas in court.  State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula, with Attorney Anna M Kees in court.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and recites the offer as listed on the document.  State and Mr. Sicula confirm the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 (with the repeater enhancer struck), Court finds defendant guilty. 

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Mr. Sicula.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:
The Court Orders the Following:

1 Day Jail (1 Day Credit) **TIME SERVED**

COSTS: $243.00;
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 60 days.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.

4:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derek J Thomas in court.  SPD Intern Patrick Sicula for Attorney Anna M Kees in court for Derek J Thomas. 

The Defense requests a date for plea/sentencing in front of the trial court.
The Court will adjourn.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Pre-trial conference on August 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

08:32 AM Defendant Derek J Thomas in court with State Public Defender Law Intern for attorney Anna Kees.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Kees appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
